info.title: Cisco-IOS-XE-bgp-nbr-oper
info.description:
This module contains a collection of YANG definitions
     for bgp neighbor operational data and Counters.
     Copyright (c) 2024-2025 by Cisco Systems, Inc.
     All rights reserved.

Cisco IOS-XE operational state data (read-only).
**Category:** Routing Protocols
**Paths:** 9

if-name.description: Contains interface name if this neighbor is a link-local address, empty otherwise

af.description: Address family under which the neighbor is activated

ni-name.description:
Network instance name. If the type is net-inst-default,
         the name is not meaningful

ni-type.description:
Network instance type. Differentiates between the
         default routing instance and VRFs

hold-time.description: The negotiated hold time with the neighbor

keepalive-time.description: The negotiated keepalive interval with the neighbor

path-mtu-dis.description: Indication whether path MTU discovery is enabled

local-port.description: Local TCP port used for TCP session

local-host.description: Local address used for the TCP session

foreign-port.description: Remote port used by the peer for the TCP session

foreign-host.description: Remote address of the BGP session

mss.description: Maximum data segment size for this tcp session in bytes

ao-key.description: Name of the key chain for AO

ao-key-id.description: ID of the AO key chain

ver.description:
BGP version being used to communicate
         with the remote router

hold-time.description: The negotiated hold time with the neighbor

keepalive-time.description: The negotiated keepalive interval with the neighbor

timers.description: Negotiated timers status of BGP neighbor

path-mtu-dis.description: Indication whether path MTU discovery is enabled

local-port.description: Local TCP port used for TCP session

local-host.description: Local address used for the TCP session

foreign-port.description: Remote port used by the peer for the TCP session

foreign-host.description: Remote address of the BGP session

mss.description: Maximum data segment size for this tcp session in bytes

ao-key.description: Name of the key chain for AO

ao-key-id.description: ID of the AO key chain

cur-prfx.description: The current number of accepted prefixes

acc-prfx.description: The total number of accepted prefixes

imp-with.description:
The number of times a prefix has been
         withdrawn and readvertised

exp-with.description:
The number of times a prefix has been
         withdrawn because it is no longer feasible

bpath.description: The number of received prefixes installed as best paths

mpath.description: The number of received prefixes installed as multipaths

total-est.description:
The number of times a TCP and BGP
         connection has been successfully established

total-dropped.description:
The number of times that a valid
         session has failed or been taken down

last-reset.description:
When was the peering session was last reset,
         if the session has never been reset, this value is meaningless

reset-reason.description: The reason for the last reset

up-time.description: When was the session established with the neighbor

last-write.description: When was the last sent a message to the neighbor

last-read.description: When was the last received a message from the neighbor

cur-prfx.description: The current number of accepted prefixes

acc-prfx.description: The total number of accepted prefixes

The number of times a prefix has been
         withdrawn and readvertised

exp-with.description:

         withdrawn because it is no longer feasible
